newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Schweppes Belgium sees production doubling in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Schweppes Belgium sees production doubling in 1997.

text.p: Schweppes Belgium SA, a unit of Cadbury Schweppes, said on Wednesday its new bottled water product, San Benedetto Source Bonne Fontaine, would help it double production volume in 1997 and triple it by 2000.

The Belgian company expects to produce a total 62.5 million litres of drinks in 1997 and has invested 500 million Belgian francs in an integrated plastic bottle-making production line at its site in Genval, near Brussels.
The plant began bottling water around the start of the year after Schweppes signed a technical and commercial agreement with Italian mineral water and soft drinks company San Benedetto.
"(We) want it to be the best price-to-quality brand on the market," Michel Petit, managing director of Schweppes Belgium, told a news conference.
The water, priced about 21 francs a bottle, comes from a Genval source and is already used to make other Schweppes soft drinks there.
Schweppes Belgium said the bottled water market had been expanding continuously since 1985.
Its studies showed almost 40 percent of customers who bought brand-name mineral water were prepared to change to a similar quality product selling at a lower price.
Schweppes Belgium had turnover of 1.4 billion Belgian francs in 1995 and sold 35 million litres of drinks, accounting for 3.5 percent of the Belgian soft drinks market.
